Edit the highlighted locations in the sentence so they are consistent with each other. Additionally, make sure that the verb tenses used in both clauses are in the past perfect tense. Furthermore, the sentence must also include at least one adjective to describe the speaker's current residence in the United States. 
I had been living in the United States of America for several years, but I was originally from Canada. Despite the harsh winters and remote location, I find my current residence in the bustling city of New York to be exhilarating.

I had been living in the bustling city of New York in the United States of America for several years, but I had originally been from Canada. Despite the harsh winters and remote location of my past, I find my current residence in this vibrant city to be exhilarating.
